question: Why am I chopping onions and you're frying the tofu? This seems unfair.
Think about it, if you chop onions and I fry tofu, we make dinner faster. It's all about teamwork!
You always get to feed the dog, while I'm stuck with cleaning his mess. It's not fair!
Well, if we both tried to feed him, who would handle the mess? Remember, each job is important!
Why am I always on dish duty while you're the taste tester?
Well, if we both cooked, who would do the dishes? Plus, you're better at not breaking plates, and I'm better at not burning food.
I made these cupcakes because I love baking, but now everyone wants to buy them. What's up with that?
That's the invisible hand! You did what you loved, and it benefited everyone!
I started making masks because I couldn't find any, and now I'm selling them to others. Strange, isn't it?
Not at all! That's the invisible hand at work. You filled a need, and the market responded.
I planted these trees just for shade, but now people are buying their fruits. I never planned for this.
That's the invisible hand guiding you. You did something for your own benefit, and it ended up benefiting others too!
I thought the government would interfere when I started my lemonade stand, but nothing happened!
That's laissez-faire, my friend. They let the market do its thing.
The government doesn't interfere with my burger stand, and my business is booming!
That's the beauty of laissez-faire economics. You're free to succeed or fail on your own.
I can't believe the government lets me sell these funky socks without any regulations.
Well, that's laissez-faire for you. They believe the market can regulate itself.
Why do you think I should start a bakery, even though I'm allergic to gluten?
Well, you're always talking about how much you love money and business. That's self-interest driving you.
I want to open a pet store. I love pets and I also see a great business opportunity.
That sounds like a perfect blend of passion and self-interest.
I'm working overtime, not because I love my job but because I want to buy a new car.
That's a classic example of self-interest. You're motivated by your personal gain.
Why does my dentist never do the cleaning? The hygienist always does it.
That's specialization. The dentist focuses on diagnosing and treating issues, the hygienist on cleanings.
I only cook Thai food at my restaurant. Do you think I should expand to other cuisines?
No, stick to your specialty. Specialization can actually be beneficial in business.
My friend is a heart surgeon, but he never handles general surgeries. Why is that?
That's because in medicine, doctors often specialize in a specific field to become experts in it.
Why do concert tickets always sell out so fast?
That's market equilibrium. The supply of tickets meets the demand at a certain price, and then they're all gone.
I don't get it. Why doesn't the price of my favorite candy ever change?
It's probably because the supply and demand for it are in equilibrium. The sellers are happy with the price and so are the buyers.
Why are rent prices so high in the city but so low in the suburbs?
That's market equilibrium. High demand and limited supply in the city drive up prices, while it's the opposite in the suburbs.
Why did the price of avocados skyrocket?
Must be the law of supply and demand. Maybe there was a bad harvest and the supply dropped.
options: Law of Supply and Demand (correct answer)

question: I don't get why gas prices always go up in the summer.
It's the law of supply and demand. More people travel in the summer, so demand goes up and so do prices.
options: Law of Supply and Demand (correct answer)

question: Why are vintage comic books so expensive?
That's the law of supply and demand. The supply is limited because they don't make them anymore, and the demand is high among collectors.
options: Law of Supply and Demand (correct answer)

question: Why do we pay taxes, anyway?
The government needs money to build roads, schools, and other public goods. That's a part of their role!
Why can't I just throw my trash anywhere?
One role of the government is to enforce laws, like littering laws, to keep our environment clean.
I'm starting a business. Why do I need a license?
That's part of the government's role. They regulate businesses to protect consumers and ensure fair competition.
Why is my boss always pushing us to work faster?
That's productivity for you! The more goods or services produced in a given time, the higher the economic growth.
I just invented a machine that can make twice as many widgets in the same amount of time!
Wow, your productivity boost will certainly help the economy grow.
Why are we always updating our software?
Keeping up with the latest tech increases our productivity, which in turn fuels economic growth.
Why is the price of my favorite cereal going up?
That's the 'natural price' in action. The cost of the ingredients must have risen.
I don't get why some sneakers are so expensive.
It's all about natural price. It reflects the cost of production, including labor, materials, etc.
Why is organic food more expensive than regular food?
The 'natural price' is higher because it costs more to grow food organically.
I've been working at this job for a year and haven't seen a raise!
Maybe the company's profits aren't rising. Remember, wages and profits are often linked.
Why do CEOs earn so much more than regular employees?
It's a contentious issue. The idea is that their decisions can significantly impact profits, so they get a larger share.
My friend's small business is booming, and he's getting a significant raise!
That's how it works. As profits rise, so can wages, especially in a small business.
I can't believe how much money Uncle Scrooge has in his vault!
That's the accumulation of capital for you. It's not just about earning but also saving and investing.
Why is it important to save money?
Because of the principle of accumulation of capital. The more capital you have, the more you can invest and grow your wealth.
I bought another rental property!
Ah, working on the accumulation of capital, are you?
I just won the lottery! I'm going to buy a yacht!
Or you could invest in some real estate or stocks. You know, the whole 'saving and investment' thing.
Why is my piggy bank always empty?
Maybe because you're not practicing the concept of saving and investment. You need to keep some coins in there to grow!
I can't wait to spend my paycheck on this new video game console!
Or you could put it into a savings account and watch it grow... just a thought.
I'm starting a lemonade stand!
Nice! Just remember, competition is like lemonade, too sweet can be overpowering, but too sour and no one will drink it.
I just created an app that tells you when to drink water!
Nice! But there's already 50 apps doing the same. Welcome to the world of competition.
I'm the only one selling homemade cookies in the neighborhood!
Enjoy it while it lasts. Once Mrs. Jones gets wind of this, you'll learn about the role of competition.
